question: A train 180 m long passes a man walking in the same direction at 6 km/h in 18 seconds. Find the speed of the train in km/h.
A sum of ₹12,000 amounts to ₹15,552 in 2 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
A boat travels 16 km downstream in 2 hours and the same distance upstream in 4 hours. Find the speed of the boat in still water.
Two pipes can fill a cistern in 12 and 15 minutes respectively. A waste pipe can empty it in 6 minutes. If all pipes are opened together, how long will it take to fill the cistern?
A, B, and C together can complete a piece of work in 6 days. A alone can complete it in 18 days and B in 9 days. In how many days can C alone complete it?
The average age of 10 students is 20 years. If a teacher’s age is included, the average increases by 2 years. Find the teacher’s age.
A person invests ₹10,000 at 10% p.a. compounded annually. Find the amount after 3 years.
The difference between the squares of two consecutive numbers is 31. Find the smaller number.
A can finish a work in 15 days, B in 20 days, and C in 30 days. If they all work together, in how many days will they finish it?
The population of a town increases by 10% annually. If the population in 2022 was 20,000, what will it be in 2025?
A train crosses a platform in 36 seconds and a man standing on the platform in 20 seconds. If the train’s speed is 54 km/h, find the length of the platform.
A man invests ₹8,000 in a scheme that offers 20% compound interest per annum. Find the amount after 2 years if interest is compounded annually.
A rectangular field has a length that is 4 m more than twice its breadth. If the perimeter is 64 m, find the area.
The ratio of the present ages of A and B is 4:5, and the sum of their ages is 45 years. What will be the ratio of their ages after 5 years?
A car’s speed increases by 20% and then decreases by 20%. Find the net percentage change in speed.
If 3x + 2y = 12 and 2x + 3y = 13, find the value of x + y.
A sum becomes 4 times in 12 years at simple interest. In how many years will it double?
A man spends 80% of his income. His income increases by 25% and his expenditure by 20%. Find the percentage change in his savings.
A and B together can do a work in 8 days, while A alone can do it in 12 days. In how many days can B alone do it?
A man bought 5 dozen bananas for ₹60 and sold them at the rate of ₹15 per dozen. Find his profit percent.
The sum of the ages of a father and his son is 60 years. After 10 years, the father’s age will be twice the son’s age. Find their present ages.
A man can row 8 km/h in still water. If the stream’s speed is 2 km/h, find his upstream speed.
If the average of 5 numbers is 24, and the average of 3 of them is 20, find the average of the remaining two numbers.
A trader mixes 10 kg of sugar at ₹20/kg with 15 kg at ₹30/kg. Find the average price per kg of the mixture.
A person walks 2/3 of a distance at 4 km/h and the remaining at 6 km/h. Find his average speed for the entire journey.
The sum of the digits of a two-digit number is 9. If 27 is added to the number, its digits are reversed. Find the number.
The ratio of milk to water in a mixture is 7:5. If 6 liters of water is added, the ratio becomes 7:8. Find the quantity of milk in the mixture.
A and B invest in a business in the ratio 3:5. After 8 months, A withdraws half of his capital. If the total profit at the end of the year is ₹24,000, find B’s share.
A man covers 1/3 of a distance at 4 km/h and the remaining at 5 km/h. If he takes 36 minutes to cover the total distance, find the total distance.
A trader marks an article 25% above cost price and allows 10% discount. Find the gain percent.
The difference between the compound interest and simple interest on ₹10,000 for 2 years at 10% p.a. is:
A train 150 m long crosses another train 100 m long running in the opposite direction in 10 seconds. If the speed of the first train is 45 km/h, find the speed of the second train.
A sum of ₹5,000 becomes ₹6,600 in 2 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The ratio of two numbers is 4:5. If each number is increased by 20, the ratio becomes 5:6. Find the numbers.
A shopkeeper buys an article for ₹720 and marks it at 25% above cost price. He sells it after allowing 10% discount. Find his profit percent.
A man travels 15 km at 5 km/h, 20 km at 10 km/h, and 30 km at 15 km/h. Find his average speed.
If 12 men can build a wall in 18 days, how many days will 9 men take to build the same wall?
A sum of ₹2,000 becomes ₹2,420 in 2 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The perimeter of a rectangle is 56 m and its breadth is 12 m. Find its area.
A trader sells two articles at ₹1,000 each. On one he gains 20% and on the other he loses 20%. Find his overall gain or loss percent.
A certain number is divided by 13; it leaves a remainder 8. What will be the remainder when the square of that number is divided by 13?
A can complete a work in 10 days and B in 15 days. They work together for 5 days. What fraction of work remains?
A sum of ₹8,000 becomes ₹9,680 in 2 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The simple interest on ₹1,200 at 5% per annum for certain years is ₹300. Find the time period.
A number when divided by 899 gives a remainder 63. What will be the remainder when the number is divided by 29?
A man can row 12 km downstream in 3 hours and return in 6 hours. Find the speed of the stream.
A trader sells 80% of his goods at 25% profit and the rest at 10% loss. Find his overall profit percent.
A man invested ₹20,000 in 12% stock at ₹120. Find his income.
A man can complete a work in 12 days. With the help of a boy, he can do it in 8 days. In how many days can the boy alone do it?
The difference between the compound interest and simple interest on a certain sum for 2 years at 8% p.a. is ₹128. Find the sum.
